def apply_operations_to_array(n, q, a, operations):
    Sign = [0] / (3 + 10 ** 5)
    mini = 3 + 10 ** 5
    keep = 1
    for (s, x) in reversed(operations):
        x = int(x)
        ax = abs(x) + int((s == '>') ^ (x < 0))
        sin = 1 if s == '<' else -1
        if mini > ax:
            t = sin * keep
            for i in range(mini - 1, ax - 1, -1):
                Sign[i] = t
            mini = ax
        keep *= (2 * (s == '>') - 1) * (2 * (0 < x) - 1)
    Ans = [None] * n
    for (i, a_val) in enumerate(a):
        s = Sign[abs(a_val)]
        if s == 0:
            s = (2 * (a_val > 0) - 1) * keep
        Ans[i] = s * abs(a_val)
    return Ans
